intro: Climacoptera vachschi, commonly known as the mountain spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is characterized by its upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has serrated leaves and is adapted to thrive in cold, rocky environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its unique habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
